text: Did you know rockets work like giant soda bottles? When you shake a soda and open it, the pressure shoots the liquid out—rockets use the same idea, but with fiery exhaust! Take SpaceX’s Falcon 9: it burns fuel to create thrust, launching into space. Think of it as a controlled explosion pushing against the ground. How do you think scientists steer something so powerful?

text: Rockets aren’t just for space—they’re cosmic delivery trucks! The Saturn V, which sent astronauts to the Moon, was as tall as a 36-story building. Modern rockets like NASA’s SLS carry supplies to the ISS. Imagine packing your lunch, but for a trip 250 miles above Earth! What would you send to space if you could design a mission?
